title: Export packaging for source ZIP and cPanel-ready static build

requirements.summary: Add an in-repo EXPORT.md guide describing how to zip the full source and a cPanel-ready static build.
acceptanceCriteria: Repository contains an EXPORT.md at the project root (or a clearly discoverable docs file) written in English.
EXPORT.md includes steps to: install dependencies, build the project, locate the build output folder, and create ZIP archives for both the full source and the static build.
EXPORT.md explicitly states what folder(s) to upload to cPanel for the static site (the build output directory) and that the React source itself is not directly uploadable without building.

file_operations.description: Create an English export guide explaining: dependency install, production build, where the static output is generated (e.g., dist/), how to create a ZIP of (1) full source (excluding node_modules and build output) and (2) the static build, and which folder to upload to cPanel public_html. Reference the npm scripts added in REQ-9. (Using build-template-react conventions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

requirements.summary: Add npm scripts to build and package two ZIP deliverables (full source ZIP + static-build ZIP) via a single command.
acceptanceCriteria: Project defines scripts to: (a) build the frontend for production, (b) create a ZIP of the build output, and (c) create a ZIP of the full project source (excluding node_modules and build artifacts).
Running the packaging script(s) produces two ZIP files with clear names (one for source, one for static build) in a documented output location.
The static build output contains an index.html and asset files that can be served by a basic static host (like cPanel) without server-side rendering.

file_operations.description: Add/define npm scripts for production build and packaging: one script for the production static build, and a single command that generates two ZIPs (source + static build) into a documented output folder (e.g., frontend/exports/). Ensure source ZIP excludes node_modules and build artifacts. Align script naming/structure with build-template-react. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a Node-based packaging script that (1) triggers/assumes a completed production build, (2) zips the build output directory into a clearly named static-build ZIP, and (3) zips the project source into a clearly named source ZIP while excluding node_modules and build output. Use deterministic output folder and filenames as documented in EXPORT.md.

requirements.summary: Ensure the production static build uses asset paths and anchor navigation that work when hosted from cPanel public_html root.
acceptanceCriteria: After building, opening the generated index.html via a static server shows the same single-page marketing site layout (Header, Hero, About, Collections, Why Shop With Us, Contact, Footer).
Hero background and logo load correctly from the generated/static assets (e.g., /assets/generated/*) without 404s in the built output.
Anchor navigation (#about, #collections, #contact) works in the built static output.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero background image as a static public asset at this exact path so production builds can serve it without broken links.
Add the generated logo image as a static public asset at this exact path so production builds can serve it without broken links.

Verify the hero background image reference points to the public static asset path (frontend/public/assets/generated/abaya-store-hero-abaya-hijab.dim_1920x1080.png) and remains compatible with production static builds hosted at the cPanel public_html root. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Verify the header logo reference points to the public static asset path (frontend/public/assets/generated/zaya-logo.dim_512x512.png) and remains compatible with production static builds hosted at the cPanel public_html root. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Verify the footer logo reference points to the public static asset path (frontend/public/assets/generated/zaya-logo.dim_512x512.png) and remains compatible with production static builds hosted at the cPanel public_html root. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
